STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER ELIZABETH HERTEL
LANSING
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
June 21, 2021
Jamie Lovelace
Eaton County DHHS
1050 Independence Blvd
Charlotte, MI 48813
RE: License #: CP230201103
Dear Mr. Lovelace:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
6/14/21. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. It should be
noted that violations of any licensing statutes and rules and are also violations of the
MISEP and policy. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter
and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of policy or MISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular certificate of approval
license will be issued. If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan,
disciplinary action will result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 552-3662.
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Rorie Dodge-Garnaat, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
235 Grand, Ste 1305
P.O. Box 30650
Lansing, MI 48909
(517) 899-6024
enclosure
2

DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules
except for the following:
R 400.12418 Development of service plans.
(2) An agency shall complete written service plans for each
child and parent or parents, as follows:
(a) Within 30 calendar days from removal from the home.
1 of 1 Initial Service Plan reviewed was completed 4 days late.
R 400.12504 Eligibility requirements.
(1) An agency shall document the rationale for selection of
independent living as the most appropriate placement for the
youth.
1 of 3 Independent living files indicated in the PATP that the youth is unable to live
independently.
R 400.12509 Independent living record.
(3) The case record shall contain all of the following information
and documentation, which shall be recorded within 30 calendar
days after placement in independent living and updated at least
once every 90 calendar days:
(g) Current documentation of financial support sufficient to
meet the youth's housing, clothing, food, and miscellaneous
expenses.
1 of 3 Independent living files reviewed did not have quarterly budgets completed in
order to ensure sufficient financial support.
R 400.12510 Independent living contract.
(2) The agreement shall be signed and dated by the youth and
the social service worker. The contract shall be reviewed and
updated at least once every 90 calendar days and a copy
provided to the youth.
4

1 of 3 Independent living files reviewed did not have quarterly contracts completed.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there
are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The
facility is in compliance will all additional MISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHHS Policy violation. Please note that
there are additional DHHS Policy requirements that may not be included in
section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHHS Policy
requirements except for the following:
FOM 722-06B FTM Practice Guidance Documentation
The DHHS-1105, Family Team Meeting Report, is used to
capture family demographics, FTM logistical information, needs,
strengths, action steps, safety concerns and the safety plan,
and any recommendations made for the family during the FTM.
The DHHS-1105, FTM Report, must be completed for every
FTM.
1 of 3 foster care files reviewed did not have documentation for an FTM.
This is a repeat violation cited during the 2020 Interim Inspection with a CAP
accepted on 10/13/20.
FOM 722-06H TIMELY ENTRY OF CASEWORKER CONTACTS
All face-to-face contacts must be entered in MiSACWIS within
five business days of the contact.
12 out of 36 face to face visits reviewed were entered late into MiSACWIS.
This is a repeat violation cited during the 2020 Interim Inspection with a CAP
accepted on 10/13/20.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility did not require technical assistance at this time.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility did not require consultation at this time.
5

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period. The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans this
licensing period.
The agency has done a great job at ensuring all PATP’s are signed and all medical
passports are completed despite COVID restrictions. They have two repeat
violations, but the late entry of contacts was significantly less this year. The agency
struggled with the removal of several of their youth from CCI’s and expressed
concerns about the amount of staff time this took as well as the lack of support
received from other units within the department.
VII. ANALYST FINDINGS
DHHS Field Analyst Jackie Carter completed three home visits to foster homes
licensed by Eaton County DHHS and one relative home. All four homes had positive
things to say about the agency and did not express any concerns.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes, rules, and policy requirements. Upon receipt of an acceptable
corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility will be issued a renewal of
their regular license.
6/21/21
________________________________________
Rorie Dodge-Garnaat Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
June 21, 2021
________________________________________
Claudia Triestram Date
Area Manager
